definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
the straw that broke the camel’s back (idiom)/the final straw
pinyin: ya1 si3 luo4 tuo5 de5 zui4 hou4 yi1 gen1 dao4 cao3
containing_words.word: 壓死駱駝的最後一根稻草

definition: xylitol (Cantonese)/see also 木糖醇[mu4 tang2 chun2]

lit. even a scrawny camel is bigger than a horse (idiom)/fig. even after suffering a loss, a rich person is still better off than ordinary people/a cultured person may come down in the world, but he is still superior to the common people
pinyin: shou4 si3 de5 luo4 tuo5 bi3 ma3 da4

sentences.english: I took him on my shoulder and then carried him down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 後來發現我扛不動他，就去借了一匹馬，駝着他下山。

sentences.english: From a distance, the monkey king saw the water demon carrying the flowers and following the prince.
sentences.chinese: 老猴王遠遠地看見水妖駝着花跟在王子身後。

sentences.english: Said the charge nurse. 'A little thin, tall and kind of bow-backed.
sentences.chinese: 病人說，“瘦瘦高高的，背有點駝。”

sentences.english: Try not to walk with such a stoop.
Betty is trying to spin enough llama yarn to make a sweater.
sentences.chinese: 貝蒂想紡出足夠的駝毛線來織毛衣。

sentences.english: The kiwi which is New Zealand's national bird , is one of these types of flightless birds .
sentences.chinese: 駝是新西蘭的國鳥，它就是這些不能飛行的鳥類之一。

sentences.english: He is a stooped figure with a pale and puffy face, hunched in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 他背已駝了，面孔蒼白浮腫，蜷縮着身子坐在椅子上。

sentences.english: He killed the camel and also broke the jar.
Let it cool. Set aside; Cut the cooled camel pad into slices.
sentences.chinese: 駝掌晾涼後，切成大抹刀片備用。

sentences.english: West it sees desert sheep run.
The old man walked with a stoop.

sentences.chinese: 穿小羊駝，喫甜味薄燒鮪魚片。

sentences.english: I shall be all right in an hour or two, ' said Durbeyfield.
sentences.chinese: 又裝兩個料袋袱駝，拴在馬上的。

sentences.english: The vicuna is the smallest member of the camel family.
sentences.chinese: 小羊駝是駱駝家族中體型最小的成員。

sentences.english: The children would fill their shoes with straw and food for St Nicholas's for the reindeer that carried the gifts.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們會在鞋中放上草料和食物來慰勞駝禮物的馴鹿。

definition: load carried by a pack animal
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
snail/Taiwan pr. [gua1]/see 蝸牛|蜗牛[wo1 niu2]
